tips.title: Comment and uncomment code
tips.html: Use %1 / shortcut to comment and uncomment lines of code

tips.title: Quick search in tree views
tips.html:
Quick search is available in many tree views represenging database schema, for example, in the Schema Editor and SQL Editor.Start typing in the search field at the bottom of the tree view, and you'll quickly find the necessary items.
Use the menu to specify extended matching options, e.g. regular expressions or wildcards.

tips.title: Navigate to object
tips.html: To navigate to the field, table or any other schema object, hold %1 and click the object name in your code.The object will be selected in the schema tree.

tips.title: Find and replace
tips.html: Press %1 F to display the search bar. Check Replace to add another field where you can type the replace string.

tips.title: Duplicate a code block or a line
tips.html: Press %1 D in the editor to duplicate the selected code block, or the current line when no block is selected.

tips.title: Format query
tips.html: To reformat entire text or selected block click the Format Query button located above the editing area.

tips.title: Autocompletion
tips.html:
The autocompletion list is shown automatically during editing. If it was closed, you can show it again using %1 . shortcut.
Press Enter to use selected suggestion.
Press Tab to add common prefix In case selected suggestion has common prefix with one or more other items.

tips.title: Use colors for objects
tips.html:
You can use colors to distinguish between your connections and their subelements.To set a color to a connection or its subobject, right-click the element and select desired color in the context menu
  • Click X to reset the color.
  • Click ... to set a custom color
The color is applied in the Schema Editor, main window tabs, Data Editor columns.

tips.title: Open a table in the Data Editor
tips.html:
When you double-click a table in the Schema Editor, the table opens in the Data Editor.
In the Data Editor, you can create and delete new rows, modify existing ones, filter data by a column, view data in the separate dialog.

tips.title: Search in your query history
tips.html: You can use text search in the SQL Editor query history if you are looking for a particular request.Just switch to your recent queries, select the viewing scope and input search term.

tips.title: Query parameters
tips.html:
Use the Parameters panel to pass correct values for the parameters in your statement.Uncheck the Use Parameters checkbox to temporary disable applying parameters.
The latest parameters set is saved for each distinct query in the recent queries history.

tips.title: Save DDL scripts to source control system
tips.html: Source Control tool allows you to save DDL definitions of the schema objects in a number of SQL scripts. That way you can store the database structure in the Version Control System (VCS)

tips.title: Filter in the Data Editor
tips.html: To use a filter in the Data Editor, press %1 F.

tips.title: How to create a diagram
tips.html: You can create a diagram for a database.In the Schema Editor, right-click a database object and select Create->Diagram...Tick Add Existing Tables checkbox if you want to visualize or edit an existing structure of the database.

tips.title: Autocompletion
tips.html: With RegEx autocompletion, enabled by default, you can type any characters that exist anywhere in an identifier.It is controlled by the preference: Application->General->SQL Editing->Autocompletion style

tips.title: Compare database structure
tips.html: You can compare two database structures and see the differences in tables, columns, keys, indexes, and other structural database elements (Tools->SQL Diff)

tips.title: Autocompletion
tips.html: Autocompletion accelerates the process of completing code statements by presenting a list of suggestions from the current caret position as you type

tips.title: Recursive tree manipulation
tips.html: All trees in Valentina Studio allow you to do %1+Click to close/open recursively all sub-items.

tips.title: Bonjour
tips.html: The first section of the Start Page Servers has Bonjour list of auto-recognized Valentina Servers in the local network. You can click one of them to connect or use its contextual menu to add it to bookmarks.

tips.title: Export bookmarks
tips.html:
You can export/import bookmarks into file using:
  • the contextual menu of the Bookmarks tab of the Servers section on the Start Page
  • the main menu File->Bookmarks
  • the Bookmarks button on the main toolbar
Note, Valentina Studio can automatically sync your bookmarks between your computers using Apple iCloud, Dropbox, Google Drive, etc.

tips.title: Open a database with drag&drop
tips.html: You can drag&drop a local Valentina or SQLite database file to the middle section of the Start Page to open it.

tips.title: Examples
tips.html: On the Start Page, you can see a few example databases and projects which are cloud-based, they are not copied to your disk by installer, but are loaded from an external storage. These databases and projects have an icon with a cloud.Note, you can hide examples in the context menu or in the preferences (Application->General)

tips.title: Field sorting
tips.html:
You can see fields in order of creation:
  • You can click button Sort List in the toolbar to change this option for the current list of Schema Editor.

  • Also, you can set this option globally in the preferences of Valentina Studio

tips.title: Form creation
tips.html:
To create a form:
  1. Create or open an existing project (e.g. menu File->New Project->Local...)
  2. On the project tab, click Create->Form...
  3. Using the Form Wizard, setup a basic form

tips.title: View sizes of multiple tables at once
tips.html:
To view sizes of multiple tables at once:
  1. Switch to the Tree Mode using a button in the top-left corner of the Schema Editor
  2. Select the Tables list in the tree
  3. In the contextual menu of the properties table header click Choose Shown Properties...
  4. Check the Size checkbox
Note, now you can also sort tables by their size.

tips.title: Find values starting with string
tips.html:
You can find values starting with a specified string using the following filter:
LIKE 'str%'More information about filters here
